name: ListOnCallEntries
description:
Retrieve on-call entries for a specified time range.

This tool fetches the on-call entries indicating who is scheduled to be on call during a specified time period. This can be used to determine coverage for escalation policies and rules. Note that specific OAuth permissions ('oncalls.read') are required, and rate limits may apply.

parameters.name: accept_versioning_header
parameters.description: Specifies the versioning format for the request. Use this to set the `Accept` header for API versioning.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type_header
parameters.description: Specifies the media type for the request. Use 'application/json'.

parameters.name: results_time_zone
parameters.description: Specifies the time zone for rendering results. Defaults to the account time zone if not provided.

value_schema.description: Time zone in which results will be rendered. This will default to the account time zone.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: The maximum number of on-call entries to return per page. Set this to control pagination.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: pagination_offset
parameters.description: Offset indicating where to start the pagination for search results.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: additional_details_to_include
parameters.description: Array of additional details to include such as escalation policies, users, or schedules.

value_schema.description: Array of additional details to include.

parameters.name: filter_user_ids
parameters.description: An array of user IDs to filter and show only the on-calls for these users.

value_schema.description: Filters the results, showing only on-calls for the specified user IDs.

parameters.name: filter_by_escalation_policy_ids
parameters.description: Array of escalation policy IDs to filter the on-call results. Only entries matching these IDs will be included.

value_schema.description: Filters the results, showing only on-calls for the specified escalation policy IDs.

parameters.name: schedule_ids_filter
parameters.description: Array of schedule IDs to filter results. Include `null` to cover permanent on-calls from direct user escalations.

value_schema.description: Filters the results, showing only on-calls for the specified schedule IDs. If `null` is provided in the array, it includes permanent on-calls due to direct user escalation targets.

parameters.name: start_time_range
parameters.description: The start time for the search range. On-call periods overlapping this time will be included. Defaults to the current time. Limited to 90 days in the future.

value_schema.description: The start of the time range over which you want to search. If an on-call period overlaps with the range, it will be included in the result. Defaults to current time. On-call shifts are limited to 90 days in the future.

parameters.name: end_time_for_on_call_search
parameters.description: Specify the end of the time period to search for on-call entries. The end time must be after the start time ('since') and cannot exceed 90 days in the future. Defaults to current time if not specified.

value_schema.description: The end of the time range over which you want to search. If an on-call period overlaps with the range, it will be included in the result. Defaults to current time. On-call shifts are limited to 90 days in the future, and the `until` time cannot be before the `since` time.

parameters.name: include_total_in_response
parameters.description: Set to true to populate the total field in pagination responses, enhancing the response with total entry count.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

parameters.name: return_earliest_on_call
parameters.description: Set to true to filter and return only the earliest on-call entry for each combination of escalation policy, escalation level, and user.

value_schema.description: This will filter on-calls such that only the earliest on-call for each combination of escalation policy, escalation level, and user is returned. This is useful for determining when the "next" on-calls are for a given set of filters.
